basics.name: Chris Tomy
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Chris Tomy has professional experience in full-stack development, and research experience applying logic programming to container build systems. Academically, his studies at UCL instilled an ability to deep dive into a broad range of technical topics, from the low-levels of x86-64 assembly to modern neural network architecture.

work.name: G-Research
highlights: Developing, debugging, and deploying algo services in addition to other services that support the trading platform.
Understanding the domain-specific concepts necessary to operate trading services in co-located datacenters around the world.
work.summary: Full-time software engineer working in the Realtime Quant Platform Engineering team.

work.name: G-Research
work.summary: 12 week internship as a software engineer in the Realtime Quant Tyburn Tactical team.
highlights: Built an ASP.NET web app using the Blazor UI framework. Purpose: provide views into the development pipeline of one of the major applications involved in trading. This includes the state of regression tests and live production instances of the app.
Using Prometheus, added metrics to a service and an alert for better awareness of its state.

work.name: Computer Science Department, UCL
work.summary: Supporting first year undergraduates in developing their skills in four programming languages.

work.name: Softwire
work.summary: 8 week summer internship as a software developer. Worked with a 100k+ LOC codebase on a multiplatform mobile app; production code for an app that had 110k+ downloads. Developed a supporting static site built with the Gatsby framework.

education.summary: First Class Honours in Computer Science. Made the UCL Engineering Deans List for strong academic performance.

education.area: Maths, Further Maths, and Computer Science

education.summary: Academic report on the outcomes of the P vs. NP problem. Achieved an A*.

publications.name: Modus: a Datalog dialect for building container images
publications.summary: Published in ESEC/FSE 2022: Proceedings of the 30th ACM Joint European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering.

projects.name: Modus
projects.summary: Modus is a language that facilitates parameterized container builds. My BSc final year project was implementing the frontend of this language, including the parser and translation. I also co-authored a research paper that was published in ESEC/FSE 2022.

projects.name: NudgeMe
projects.summary: NudgeMe is a cross-platform mobile wellbeing app that encourages users to look after themselves. Developed during Y2 of my BSc, through UCL's IXN programme.
